Named tuples

May 30, 2020

Main purpose: To improve readability, handy for CSV manipulation. Just as normal tuples, named tuples are immutable; canâ€™t be changed.

>>> from collections import namedtuple
>>> import json
>>> Person = namedtuple('Person', ['name','age'])
>>> p1 = Person('ali', 30)
>>> p1
'["ali", 30]'
>>> json.dumps(p1._asdict())
'{"name": "ali", "age": 30}'

Further reading

  • Official documentation
  • Writing Clean Python With Namedtuples
